abstract: The Bank of England and the European Central Bank left their interest rates unchanged on Thursday, as they sought to balance slowing growth with inflationary pressures.
snippet: The Bank of England and the European Central Bank left their interest rates unchanged on Thursday, as they sought to balance slowing growth with inflationary pressures.
lead_paragraph: ATHENS  The European Central Bank on Thursday said that Europe’s economy remained resilient despite nearly nine months of financial turmoil and it left its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 4 percent. The bank gave no sign that it was in a hurry to raise or lower borrowing costs.

headline.main: European Bank Stays Course on Rates
headline.print_headline: European Bank Stays Its Course on Rates

abstract: The merger advisory business is in a downturn, and Stefan Selig may know this as well as anyone. Mr. Selig, the global head of mergers and acquisitions at Bank of America, talked about the state of the market in an interview with Investment Dealers’ Digest, telling the publication that 2008 might look more like 2003 in terms of announced deal volume.
lead_paragraph: The merger advisory business is in a downturn, and Stefan Selig may know this as well as anyone. Mr. Selig, the global head of mergers and acquisitions at Bank of America, talked about the state of the market in an interview with Investment Dealers’ Digest, telling the publication that 2008 might look more like 2003 in terms of announced deal volume.

headline.main: BofA’s Selig on the Merger Market
